page.title: 09HOP FARMING.
page.content: Hop Farming ia apparent in the fields east of Rainham.Many workers are local housewives who travel in from the surrounding towns,in particular Rainham.They have to be at work by 8.50 a.m.The first work of the year is in {January} and involves cutting back dead vines.Breakfast is 10 minutes in weather that is often cold.Work finishes at 3 p.m.This task takes about 6 weeks. Later in the year the poles and stringing hooks have to be examined and repaired.After {Easter} the training of th hops with 6 to 8 string lines begins.Each vine goes anti-clockwise, following the sun.In {September} the vines are cut.The flowers are sent to drying sheds called {Oasts}.Farmers know how much to grow because orders can be place up to 5 years in advance.
